clickRoutine.note: recall all cards to main holder, shuffle and then deal player hands
copy player names into buttons above dealt players which will move their cards into their hand
update current player id in btnSetPlayerNamesForDealPiles
click button numPlayers times
Reset Take One and Pick Up buttons to green and enable clicks
Reset Next Player buttons to red and disable clicks
reset points and card count labels

txtGameSettings.text: Use the Settings button the first time to set the number of players, card packs, select teams and other options.
txtGameSettings.css: font-size:20px; font-weight:bold; color: white; display: flex; justify-content: left; align-items: center;

txtSetPlayerNames.text: 1. Update the player names by editing the text in the grid boxes below.
txtSetPlayerNames.css: font-size:20px; font-weight:bold; color: white; display: flex; justify-content: left; align-items: center;

txtFirstPlayer.text:
2. Click Select Player as many times as necessary until the starting player for this game is highlighted in below.
Use this button also whenever someone takes their turn early to cycle back to the correct player.
txtFirstPlayer.css: font-size:20px; font-weight:bold; color: white; display: flex; justify-content: left; align-items: center;

txtDealCards.text: 3. Click Deal Cards and ask the players to click their own named buttons below to get their cards.
txtDealCards.css: font-size:20px; font-weight:bold; color: white; display: flex; justify-content: left; align-items: center;

txtStartGame.text: 4. Click Start Game to play. At the end of a game, click the square |☰| menu button in the bottom left of the screen.
txtStartGame.css: font-size:20px; font-weight:bold; color: white; display: flex; justify-content: left; align-items: center;

clickRoutine.note: get currentPlayerId from btnSetNextPlayer properties

info.name: Bhukhar

v 1.2
info.description: Team game in Rummy family.  Cards played in sets or sequences earn points according to card value.  Team with most points wins.
